# Chapter 3: “Lists” (pp.62-73)

- orderlist are created by ol element and they help put li tags in numeral order.



- unordered list are by ul element and they help put your li tags in bullet point fashion.

![orderlist](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/5tJBpZjMAbw/maxresdefault.jpg)


# Chapter 13: “Boxes” (pp.300-329)

- The box-sizing property allows you to control the size of an element that accepts a width or a height. 

-  The css overflow property controls how content that's too big to fit into an area will be handled. 


# Review from Reading 02 - Chapter 2: “Basic JavaScript Instructions” (pp.70-73)

- Arrays are special type of daty type unlike variable can hold only one type of value and array can hold a list of value.

![arrays](data:image/jpeg;base64,)






# Chapter 4: “Decisions and Loops” from switch statements on (pp.162-182)

- The switch statement performs an evaluation of an expression, which matches the expression's case clause, and then executes statements related to that case.

- Loops are used to perform repetitive tasks based on a condition. When a condition returns true or false, the loop will continue running until it has been processed.
